name: Hotel Le Palais Prague

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were upgraded to Tower Suite. This lovely suite is on the first floor with incredible light and a nice view. The room is fantastic. Plenty of space, a little nook for dining, ample closet space, huge bathroom with heated floors, tub and shower. The sleep quality was very good – the windows are double paned and there’s no noise. The bed was a little firm, but this seems the way in Europe. The housekeeping was top notch, with turn-down service each night. The free mini bar and wifi very nice touches. Staff incredibly gracious and helpful. This hotel is a true gem – it really is five star in every way – and I’m a terrible hotel snob. For travelers used to paying top dollar in NYC, London, Paris – you will feel like you’re getting five-star treatment for the price of a Hampton Inn. The Pure Spa experience was wonderful, too. Petra gave me a hot stone massage, foot rub and neck/scalp massage. The spa is an amazing value – about $200 ish for three treatments over four hours.
reviews.title: Gracious staff, posh hotel, rare mix of elegance and value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The hotel is at the end of a residential street. There are little restaurants, bars and bodegas tucked in nearby. The walk to Wenceslas Square was easy – about 15 minutes. Didn’t take the shuttle as the walk was so easy and we like to get the feel of a city. Wenceslas Square is more of a boulevard. It’s a little on the cheesy side – the more enjoyable places were Old Town Square and the Prague Castle area. We walked up the hill to Prague Castle. Well worth the walk. The castle complex is enormous and v. beautiful.
reviews.title: Beautiful boutique hotel, super service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Prague is a lovely city and its people are welcoming. There’s little in the way of fashion here – it’s a bit like the worst of the 80s and 90s with some Liz Lemon thrown in. So, not a place for clothes shopping. But the city is very walkable, small and fun to explore. And Le Palace is one of the nicest – if not the nicest – hotels I’ve ever visited. Stay here and your trip will be special.
reviews.title: Nice boutique hotel, away from tourist areas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012
reviews.text: I stayed there for two nights during a business trip. The place and its people are very warm. The service quality is very high, especially regarding the personnel. All areas are very clean and, although a very old building, it is in a very good condition. The normal rooms are somewhat small. Even the ones without a view (a few one ones have a good view) have a view to a nice small park. Room service and service at the lobby (all available around the clock) are excellent. Moment of truth: I lost a golden pin (company logo) in the room, they found it, they emailed me and sent it to me for free (by regular mail)!
reviews.title: Friendly, except for shower.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights and the service from everyone was so attentive. The hotel belongs to the Leading Small Hotels of the World. We arranged for airport pick up from the hotel car, and upon arrival at the airport, the driver was there waiting for us. There was an extra charge for this, but after 17 hours of travel, it was nice to not have to worry about transportation in a foreign city. We felt very safe and secure in the hotel's brand new BMW 5.
reviews.title: Brilliant, get there if you can

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a 5-night stay at Le Palais. As the other reports claim, it is an unbelievable hotel in every way. We arrived at the hotel without luggage as the airlines failed to onload it at JFK. Reception asked for our luggage tracking information and told us they would follow up and deliver the bags as soon as they arrived. When we arrived at our suite, amenity kits had already been delivered and placed in the bathroom. Because we are members of the Leaders Club, we were upgraded to the Bellevue Suite with a spacious living area and well appointed bedroom/bath. A complimentary bottle of red wine, house made chocolates and a handwritten note from the general manager awaited our arrival. Plus the hotel sent a bottle of sparkling wine in honor of my birthday. And, yes, the mini bar including fruit juice, regular and diet coke, red and white wine, mineral water and chocolate is indeed free and restocked every day. Our suite was located on the first floor (2nd fl US) in the left wing with a panoramic view of the hotel's gazebo and landscape beyond. One thing I might mention is although the left wing has a better view, it also overlooks the railroad tracks and may be noisy if windows are open. Le Papillon, the hotel's restaurant served a delicious breakfast with selections for most every taste. The lunch and dinner menu are brief, but the food is well prepared and presented. And the servers are professional but not stiff and aloof. As the hotel is located a bit off the beaten track in a lovely residential setting, we reserved the complimentary hotel car service to and from Wenceslas Square, saving us from tiring/getting lost. This is a hotel I would definitely recommend to anyone. For the price it is an absolute steal.
reviews.title: Total Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012
reviews.text: Just came back from a 4 night stay in Le Palais Hotel. Words are not enough to express the perfect way by which the hotel is being managed. The staff is excellent, I would rate them with 20 out of 10... The facilities, the rooms, the breakfast, cleanliness... Everything absolutely perfect. Will definitely go back. Keep up the good work people...
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here just before Christmas with my girlfriend, it was by far our favorite hotel we've ever visited. Everything about it was amazing, we stayed in the Belle Epoque suite, which was unbelievable! The open fire was lovely to return to after a cold day in Prague and the free mini bar was well stocked and re filled every day. The bed was huge and extremely comfortable ensuring a brilliant night sleep. The buffet breakfast was outstanding with a large varied selection. We ate in La Papillion restaurant which was very nice also. The service was excellent, with special thanks to Marketa the front of house manager who went out of her way to make everything perfect for us. All in all I cannot speak highly enough about this hotel, it is truly amazing. Thanks for making our trip to Prague so memorable, and hope to return some day!
reviews.title: The most amazing hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An outstanding luxury boutique hotel. Would have no hesitation in recommending.
reviews.title: Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011
reviews.text: My husband, mother-in-law and I stayed here for three nights during Christmas. Our room was beautiful, clean, quiet, comfortable, with a great view of the garden. Tons of luxury items available: Le Occitane products, slippers, comfy robes, feather pillows, great bed, stocked fridge and my favorite heated bathroom floors.
reviews.title: Thank you Le Palais for a great taste of Prague.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed with another couple for 5 days towards the end of Nov.As previously mentioned by other reviewers it is a little way from the centre,but the hotel shuttle service(up market BMW cars!) is perfectly suited to take you into town.The advantage is that you stay in a nice suburb of Prague which is a nice change after the hubble and bubble of the centre.
reviews.title: excellent choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: An extremely attractive hotel very friendly,excellent service ,the rooms are very comfortable the cleaning staff very attentive and did a great job.Didnt actually eat in the main restaurant but the breakfast was great covered most peoples needs.
reviews.title: Hidden Boutique Hotel Gem Near Historic Center of Prague

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has an excellent spa and a very well equiped(if very underused) gym.
reviews.title: A gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Prague is a beautiful city,dont go there for the gastronomy...but as a base to visit it I cannot recomend Le Palais highly enough.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011
reviews.text: This hotel is a treasure - beautifully decorated, spacious rooms, great dining room and library with WiFi. Although it is not located in the heart of the historic area, it offers free shuttle services several times per day to its sister property which is located in the historic center. You have the best of both worlds - a quiet residential setting for a great value and convenient and free transportation to the historic sites and shopping. I would highly recommend a stay in this fine hotel where they pay attention to detail and friendly service. My marble bathroom floor was even heated!
reviews.title: Lovely traditional hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Marvelous boutique hotel. A littele away from very downtown, but just a nice walk to Wenceslas Square or 5 minutes taxi. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are spacious and nice. Just some problems with wi-fi.
reviews.title: beautiful boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: Nice hotel, nice service, huge rooms. Location not bad. Good options for lunch and dinner nearby. Cleanness according to expectations. The only point to improve is the price for long term stays, wedid not get a hot deal.
reviews.title: Good choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a luxurious hotel tucked away in a romantic part of the city. The rooms are delightful and the bathroom an extravagance. The turn down service makes you feel special. We had the spa to ourselves and felt like millionaires. The walk to town is quick and easy and you can take in the local bars on the way home. The local area has plenty of places to eat and drink, at a good price for those on a budget. The city is small and easy to get around, we didn't use the public transport. Check out the Czech Kitchen next to the market in town, well worth the experience, you won't be disappointed. Sparta Prague Ice Hockey is great fun if you have never been to a game before. A fantastic break in a lovely hotel with staff that care. Thank you Le Palais...
reviews.title: Luxury in Prague
Fantastic!
reviews.text: Stayed in January and it was fantastic. We got a fantastic rate as well which made the stay even better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean, bright and well maintained. The free minibar is a lovely treat and a nice cold drink at the end of a long day site seeing is great. The toiletries were also really nice and replenished every day.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but location a bit inaccesible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: Incredible. This hotel sets itself clearly apart from any other we are aware of in Prague. The level of service is far above any standard expected, the rooms are delightful and the staff overwhelming. You will not go wrong here if you choose to stay, which basically is a must!
reviews.title: A Gem in Prague - THE place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I believe I may be echoing the words of many other reviewers of Hotel Le Palais but when the truth is there it can't be ignored. From my first moment of contact with the Management and Staff of this fantastic hotel to the very last moment when I left every single member of staff whom I encountered worked as if I was the only guest in the hotel. They were attentive, informative, entertaining, professional, immaculately presented, knowledgeable and welcoming at every instance.
reviews.title: Complete bespoke and boutique luxury in Prague's centre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sometimes staff in top end hotels are highly trained but rarely is there the feeling of warmth and being part of a team dedicated to customer care like I have encountered at Le Palais.
reviews.title: Le Palais staff are the difference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The decor and rooms in this superior old hotel arre outstanding as is its location on the perimeter of the Old Town centre. Trams are available within metres of the front door and the efficient metro connections only a five minute walk away.
reviews.title: First class hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfasts are sumptuous and served expertly with great care taken in preparation and presentation. Also the view across the city from the restaurant adds to the whole feeling that you are in someplace special and not another anonymous hotel.
reviews.title: Very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Look no further...I researched for months about Prague hotels. Both myself and husband are very picky and have stayed in some beautiful hotels - I wanted our 20 year Wedding Anniversary trip to be perfect and it was amazing!! Le Palais is in a lovely neighborhood just a short 15 min walk away from all the noise of the city - and if you don't want to walk, there is a BMW shuttle.
reviews.title: 5 Amazing nights at Le Palais

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Le Palais is beautiful, every little detail is cared for. The rooms are very well appointed and immaculate. The bedroom was very quiet with a comfortable bed and high quality linens, bathrooms with heated floors, deep soaking tub, seperate shower and Molton Brown products. A free minibar and my favorite Nespresso machine were tucked away in a closet.
reviews.title: Amazing hotel - location is a personal preference

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Evey night when we returned a beautiful orchid and a handmade Czech gift were by my pillow, and Christmas cookies were left on the diningroom table with a bottle of wine. The cookies were so delicious, I would get up in the middle of the night to have a snack!! I really miss this little treat - no one bakes me cookies at home! Breakfast was delicious and open until late morning. We did not dine in their restaurant but it smelled wonderful - we chose to venture out into the neighborhood and had many great meals. The sauna, steamroom and whirlpool were immaculate - we went 4 out of our 5 night stay and saw only one other couple. We had a very early morning flight to Paris and we received a real person wake-up call and a breakfast box to go. We couldn't have asked for more, it truly was an amazing 5 nights at Le Palais. I wish I had booked another 3 nights at Le Palais and passed on Paris!
reviews.title: Perfectly romantic birthday treat hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All the staff from the front desk to the maids and servers in the diningroom all spoke good English and they seemed happy and always had smiles on their faces.
reviews.title: amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: For years I've talked about how I love Prague and thank you so much Le Palais for making my husband fall in love with Prague too. We cannot wait to return
reviews.title: Excellent Context for Our Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in Le Palais Almost 5 months ago with my family and it was a perfect stay ..the rooms are big and very nicely decorated ..big bathtubs and very luxurious in general.. Theyre bar works 24 hours so me and my sister who are younger could have a drink before going out at 1 am Tomas the bartender was specially nice with us and to my parents..We also had a free minibar service which we particularly enjoyed.
reviews.title: Quality price very good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Then also worth mentioning the bell boy ondre he was extremely helpfull in recommendind us where to go out aswell as arranging our transports and activities in prague ..he did not only do his job but he would daily look after us asking how our nights where ...in general he made us feel like at home ..
reviews.title: Simply Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we also had dinner at le papillon restaurant and it was wonderfull quality products and very profesional staff.
reviews.title: Excellent service, great location, beautiful hotel
Great value, great hotel
reviews.text: We will come back i really recommend it :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights in mid-January 2013. From the minute we arrived to the minute we left the hotel to go home the staff were simply amazing! The hotel is located about a 20 minute walk from Wenceslas square and taxis cost between 200 krona and 100 krona which is about £3.30 - £6.60 which we thought was reasonable. When we arrived our cases were immediately taken inside to be taken to our room. We had a tour of the hotel and then were taken to the room by the lady who checked us in. We were asked if the room was satisfactory! It was a lovely room. The pillows were the softest I had experienced - I have a bad neck and take pillows very seriously!!! The bathroom had underfloor heating, a deep bath and L'Occitane toiletries. Other little things made the room special such as the free mini bar stocked daily, clean towels in the evening if needed, turn down service, beautiful white towels (not the usual grey when they've been washed hundreds of times), shoe cleaning service. Overall the hotel was stylish, spotlessly clean and well maintained - i even saw one lady cleaning the brass with a toothbrush!! Whilst there my husband was ill with a fever and they could not have been more caring and helpful. Thank you Milan for bringing extra water to our room (at no charge) and taking the time to ask him how he was later and the next day. Breakfast was buffet style with cooked items to order. The service was excellent and the staff made the effort to remember where you sat the day before, offer a paper and even remembered that I liked eggs benedict and english breakfast tea with cold milk! Thank you especially to Zuzana and Lukas. There were a number of staff identified as trainees and I would say they are learning the very best of customer service skills. Hotel prices for drinks and food were pretty much the norm for a 5 star hotel. Local drinks were cheaper than those imported. The hotel also has a free shuttle to Wenceslas square each day at 10 am - which needs to be booked by 9am - our "shuttle" turned out to be a mercedes C class. On the day we left our flight was late evening, our bags were stored securely and the receptionist organised our taxi at exactly the time we asked,from the firm we requested (we used an airport taxi which gave a 47% discount for the return journey). Overall we had a wonderful stay and would recommend the hotel to anyone we know! We hope to go back soon!
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Prague

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very centrally located for the Old Town. We went to see German market. Took walking tour from Old Town Square. Hotel service was excellent Staff were very helpful. Breakfast buffet was very special. Room showing sign of age but still quality. TV and phone quite dated. Bed very comfortable.
reviews.title: Stylish Old Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a superb 2 night stay here just recently. The hotel is nicely situated in a quiet street with fabulous views over Prague whilst being just a short Tram or Metro ride away from the tourist area of Wenceslas Square and the Old Town .
reviews.title: Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel itself is very well maintained and tastefully decorated in sympathy with its surroundings. Our room was more than adequate with a very comfortable (and enormous!) King size bed
reviews.title: A Treat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff were attentive and the service was first class throughout.
reviews.title: Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did not eat lunch or dinner in the restaurant so cannot comment on this aspect but the breakfast served each morning in there was excellent with a huge choice to suit all sorts.
reviews.title: Prague is magical - and so it the Le Palais

description: Le Palais is Czech Republic’s top 5-star boutique hotel, one of Europe’s most luxurious 5-star experiences and a member of The Leading Hotels of the World. The hotels’ ‘Pure Spa’ presents extensive holistic treatments, the fine dining restaurant Le Papillion offers culinary delights. All hotel guests enjoy the complimentary use of mini bar and health club including fitness, sauna, steam bath with aroma showers & whirlpool, as well as shuttle service to Wenceslas Square.
